Trial_Design.evidence: 500 randomly selected postmenopausal women with osteoporosis

Participants.evidence: 500 randomly selected postmenopausal women with osteoporosis

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that abaloparatide would improve BMD in proximal femoral regions surrounding a virtual THA stem.

Method_Outcome.evidence: obtained dual x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) hip scans from 500 randomly selected postmenopausal women with osteoporosis from the Phase-3 Abaloparatide Comparator Trial in Vertebral Endpoints (ACTIVE, NCT01343004 ) study after 0, 6, and 18 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 500 randomly selected postmenopausal women with osteoporosis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Compared with placebo, the abaloparatide group showed greater increases in integral volumetric BMD in all zones at months 6 and 18
